snippet: An international group examining Cornelius Gurlitt’s cache of paintings in Germany has determined that a Matisse should be returned to a French art collector’s heirs.
abstract: International group examining cache of paintings held by Cornelius Gurlitt determines that a Matisse in collection was looted by Nazis from French collector Paul Rosenberg; recommends that work be returned to Rosenberg's heirs.
lead_paragraph: An international group examining Cornelius Gurlitt’s cache of paintings in Germany has determined that a Matisse should be returned to a French art collector’s heirs.

headline.main: Experts Say a Matisse in a Munich Art Trove Should Go to Its Owner’s Heirs
headline.print_headline: Experts Say a Matisse in a Munich Art Trove Should Go to Its Owner’s Heirs
